understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() that returns a Serializer object. It checks if the _journalSerializer variable is not null and returns it, otherwise it creates a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining which Serializer object to use. It checks if a custom Serializer object has been set in the _journalSerializer variable, and if not, it falls back to using the default JavaSerializer. This method is crucial for configuring the serialization behavior in the Prevayler creation process.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option is used when creating a Prevayler instance in the create() method. It is passed as a parameter to the PrevaylerImpl constructor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option depends on how often the create() method is called in the system. If the create() method is called frequently, then the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option will also be triggered frequently.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how it affects the behavior of the Prevayler instance. Depending on the value of _transactionDeepCopyMode, the system may perform deep copies of transactions, which could impact performance and memory usage.
